universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class ScrollableWrapper<V extends View>

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.ScrollableWrapper<V>

  • public abstract class ScrollableWrapper<V extends View>
extends Object
    A ScrollableWrapper can be used for purpose of checking whether a specific scrollable view is scrolled at its content's start or end at a time.

    This wrapper is used for example by all widgets from the UI library that support pull and thus also refresh feature.

    Supported scrollable views

    • AbsListView
    • RecyclerView
    • ScrollView
    • HorizontalScrollView
    • ViewPager
    Note that any other view supplied to wrapScrollableView(View) will be wrapped into simple wrapper implementation that always returns true from both isScrolledAtStart() and isScrolledAtEnd() methods.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      • wrapScrollableView

        public static <V extends View> ScrollableWrapper<V> wrapScrollableView(@NonNull
                                                                       V scrollableView)
        Wraps the given scrollableView into scrollable wrapper implementation that best suits to the type of the given view.
        Parameters:
        scrollableView - The scrollable view to be wrapped into scrollable wrapper.
        Returns:
        New scrollable wrapper instance. See description of this class for supported wrappers.

      • canScroll

        public boolean canScroll()
        Checks whether a content of the wrapped scrollable view can be scrolled in any direction.
        Returns:
        True if the content can be scrolled, false otherwise.

      • isScrolledAtStart

        public abstract boolean isScrolledAtStart()
        Checks whether a content of the wrapped scrollable view is at this time scrolled at its start.
        Returns:
        True if the content is scrolled at its start, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isScrolledAtEnd()

      • isScrolledAtEnd

        public abstract boolean isScrolledAtEnd()
        Checks whether a content of the wrapped scrollable view is at this time scrolled at its end.
        Returns:
        True if the content is scrolled at its end, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isScrolledAtStart()
